title: Drawing, "Design for Printed Textile-Sole, Series #417", 1958
medium: Blueprint, stamped ink, red colored pencil, graphite, on off white wove paper
markings: In green stamped ink, lower left corner:"GIRARD OFFICE COPY"
inscribed: In red colored pencil, lower left: "FILE COPY / H / M Nos 416 + 417"; in graphite, upper right corner, faint numerical calculations; in graphite, lower right corner: "58" / "59"; Imprinted upper right : "Sole" march 12, 1958, series #417
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern of thick and thin vertical stripes with alternating circles.  Annotated manufacturing instructions in English and Spanish.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Printed Textile-Sole, Series #417", 1958.Blueprint, stamped ink, red colored pencil, graphite, on off white wove paper. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-266.
